page.title: 06COLWICK RECREATIONAL AREA
page.content: AT THE SIDE OF THE RIVER TRENT THERE ARE NETTLES AND WOODS COVERING PARTS OF THE RIVER BANKS. THE RIVER TRENT IS A LARGE RIVER THAT FLOWS THROUGH THE AREA WE ARE DOING A SURVEY ON. THE RIVER TRENT IS ABOUT 30 YARDS WIDE.THE RIVER HAS BOTTLES AND RUBBISH IN IT WHERE SOME PEOPLE HAVING A PICNIC HAVE THROWN INTO THINGS INTO THE RIVER. THE RIVER BANKS ARE STEEP AND SLIPPY IN PLACES. THE VIEW IS NOT VERY GOOD BECAUSE YOU ARE QUITE LOW DOWN. WHEN YOU REACH COLWICK YOU WILL SEE QUITE A FEW AMENITIES. THERE IS A NATURE TRAIL AND PARK. THERE IS ALSO AN ASSAULT COURSE AND A SWIMMING AREA . THEY ALSO HAVE BOATING ACTIVITIES. IT IS A NICE PLACE TO WALK AROUND.
